H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H7121.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H4168.def: = iron framework; ◄ part of an altar or fire-place; ► location where objects are burned; ≈ associated with fire

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H6212.def: = any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed-bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H585.def: = act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

H1320.def: = the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat

H1692.def: = state in which objects are closely compacted together

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H1819.def: = process by which part of the body is reduced to inactivity

H4057.def: = area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

H6893.def: exact meaning unsure: = relatively small black bird; ► unclean; ≈ associated with loneliness, devastation, destruction, and possibly death

H3563.def: = small, bowl-shaped container ► used for drinking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote one's portion in life, received from God

H2723.def: = state in which a land, building, or town has been totally destroyed, ► to the extent that nobody can live there anymore

H8245.def: = state in which humans are unable to sleep

H909.def: = state of being apart from others belonging to the same group

H6833.def: = small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H1406.def: = the structure forming the upper covering of a building, usually built as a terrace, to which one goes up by stairs

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H2778.def: = causative action by which humans make an effort to arouse an emotion of shame in (other) humans or deities; ◄ by their words or actions

H1984.def: = process by which an object emits or reflects light; ≈ regarded as awesome

H7650.def: = action by which humans or deities make a solemn statement often calling on a higher power to confirm that what is said is true or to punish the speaker if it turns out not to be true

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H665.def: = powdery residue left after the burning of a substance; normally deposited outside of a village or city; ► used by mourners to put on their heads or roll themselves into; ≈ associated with things that are fine and powdery and easily scattered by the wind, with low status, and possibly with mortality as well

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H4537.def: = action by which humans mix different ingredients into a single substance

H8249.def: = a liquid for humans to drink

H2195.def: = action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

H7110.def: = process by which humans or deities respond with anger to a situation in which (other) humans have disobeyed an order or broken a law

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3001.def: = process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause

H6212.def: = any of various plants, herbs, grasses, seed-bearing vegetation that can be consumed by human and/or animal

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H2143.def: = process in which information that is stored in one's mind regarding someone or something is being reprocessed continually and/or repeatedly

H4150.def: = an action by which two or more parties come together for a particular purpose

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H6437.def: = action by which humans or animals turn their body to face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H959.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H4791.def: = a position of a relatively high elevation above the earth

H5027.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4467.def: = state in which a person or deity has been entrusted with the office of {L:king<SDBH:מֶלֶךְ>} or {L:queen<SDBH:מַלְכָּה>}

H6908.def: = action by which humans or animals come together as a group for a common purpose

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H410.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H2677.def: = one part of an object or substance that has been divided into two parts

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H5975.def: = process by which humans, deities, animals, or inanimate objects take position in a certain location in an upright position

H1086.def: = process by which objects lose their quality and strength due to continued use; ≈ used figuratively to denote the loss of a person's vitality

H899.def: = piece of cloth used to cover an object

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H2498.def: = process by which an object appears in a certain location

H8552.def: = process by which events reach the stage of completion

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H2233.def: = a flowering plant’s unit of reproduction, capable of developing into another such plant, in some cases also used as food

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place
